summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 14, 2019. It records staff checks on inmates in a continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring observation at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York SHU
events.description: Staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York's Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates held in a continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) throughout the day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York dated July 14, 2019.
It details a strict observation protocol requiring staff to check on inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs indicate the facility was actively monitoring inmates under conditions like administrative detention or disciplinary segregation on this date.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate welfare checks.
